definitions: To make a sudden assault or attack on an enemy or a place.
To enter a place, typically by force, in order to steal things.
To make a surprise visit to a place to search for something, especially by police or military.
To quickly and extensively take items from a place.
examples: The Vikings would often raid coastal villages.
He decided to raid the refrigerator for a snack.
Police raided the house looking for evidence.
The children raided the candy jar.
